heading: 2. The 24th day of March 2021 is appointed as the day on which the
text_raw:
2. The 24th day of March 2021 is appointed as the day on which the 
following provisions of the Regulated Professions (Health and Social Care) 
(Amendment) Act 2020 (No. 16 of 2020) shall come into operation: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

sections 25 and 26; 

sections 28 to 34; 

paragraph (a) of section 36; 

(d) paragraph (b) of section 37; 

(e) 

section 38; 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

sections 41 to 50; 

section 186; 

section 188. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 March, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd March, 2021.

title: 1. This Order may be cited as the Regulated Professions (Health and Social
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints the 24th day of March 2021 as the day on which certain 
provisions of the Regulated Professions (Health and Social Care) (Amendment) 
Act 2020 (No. 16 of 2020) come into operation. These provisions make a number 
of amendments to the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 mainly in 
relation to registration and fitness to practise. 

They also make minor technical amendments to the Children and Family 
Relationships Act 2015 and the Health Act 1953. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [120]
